alert.note: Alert for Lee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 3:16PM EST until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain fell yesterday. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Iona, McGregor, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, St. James City, Palmona Park, Punta Rassa, Saint James City and North Fort Myers. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
